reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel met all of our expectations and then some - perfect location for walking to sites, wonderful old Paris area with a lot of galleries and cafes, excellent hotel staff - very helpful and fluent in many languages including English AND comfortable room and satisfying breakfast.
reviews.title: Perfect in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even my French friends were impressed with the hotel.
reviews.title: The Millesime started off our 2 weeks in France with 5 stars !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for a small, boutique hotel in a location which will permit you to walk to museums, the "sights," cafes/restaurants and shopping, and which feels like being on a quiet street in a real neighborhood, you'd be hard pressed to find a better alternative, especially for the value. As soon as we walked through the front door, we felt welcomed and this continued through the week we were there with little touches like wine, fruit, cookies and macarons. Our room was simple and small but filled our needs and the bathroom was fabulous - completely redone, lots of shelf space, and - ladies, you will appreciate this - a large magnifying mirror on the wall so you don't have to stretch across the sink to put your makeup on.
reviews.title: Fantastic Service & Location (1st Class)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot comment on the breakfast room since we chose to walk 2 short blocks to the square, lined with cafes, which we came to think of as "our own;" within a day or so, we settled into our favorite cafe where the waiters began to recognize us.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What was most special, though, were the staff. Olga, Giada and Nicolas - I take my hat off to the 3 of you. All three were extremely helpful with directions, recommendations, answers to questions (many of which concerned the differences between life in Paris and life in the US) and suggestions for discounted tickets, e.g., to a spectacular concert in Ste. Chappelle and a Paris-by-night boat tour. All of this was delivered with warmth, knowledge and the feeling communicated that our enjoyment was pleasurable to them as well.
reviews.title: Sweet, intimate lovely hotel in St. Germain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We, too, chose the Millesime based on Tripadvisor, and were completely satisfied. My husband, myself, and our two young adult children arrived very early and the hotel stored our bags so we could walk around and enjoy lunch until our rooms were ready. The superior rooms are quite roomy by European standards, with comfortable beds, a desk, small dining table, and a big closet for clothes and suitcases. The bathroom was large and nicely tiled, with a very warm, powerful shower and nice toiletries. We were surprised how quiet it was, considering the room was right on the street.
reviews.title: It's all about the location and the staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a convenience we ate breakfast at the hotel and were again not disappointed. The breakfast room is lovely and the pastries are divine. Josette was a wonderfully friendly personality to wake up to each morning!
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, the best part of this place is the staff. Our French is pretty bare-bones, and everyone we met at the front desk spoke excellent English. We particularly want to thank Konstantin and Giada for their help and recommendations.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel in Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Millesime is located in Ste. Germain section, which we found to be perfect for us as first-time travelers to Paris. There were all sorts of shops, cafes, and restaurants within short walking distance, as well as 3 different Metro stops. Also, you can easily walk to the Louvre, Orsay, and Notre Dame.
reviews.title: An excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: We would recommend Au 35 down the street for dinner and Amorino on Rue Buci for gelato.
reviews.title: Left Bank delight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Millesime earlier this month and had an outstanding experience. Our package included free transportation from the airport. Our flight arrived late. Nevertheless, the hotel took care of us.
reviews.title: Parisian Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Great location in the 6th arrondissement near St. Germain des Pres.
reviews.title: Look no further!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also had a breakfast package. The breakfast room is very attractive; the staff is excellent; the selection of breakfast items is varied and very good.
reviews.title: Large rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was large; bathroom uncommonly large by European standards; the ambiance is terrific.
reviews.title: The Place to be in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: All staff were gracious, multilingual, thoughtful and completely helpful.
reviews.title: Great hotel with fabulous staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Millesime in the 6th Arrondissement for all the right reasons, and this hotel was the one we were fortunate enough to have reserved. The staff were as lovely and helpful as can be- everyone from the breakfast room Mesdames to the Chamber Maids to the Receptionists/Concierges and the Manager. The hotel is charming and immaculate, room was nice and comfy (bigger than I expected), cheerful and well-appointed, and in the most perfect location for exploring the beautiful city of lights, Paris... The tete-a-tete (head to head) with Paris package was romantic and included things we would want to do anyway, making this a perfect deal in a perfect spot with perfect hosts/hostesses! Manager Inga went above and beyond her call to duty, effectively averting what would have been a high drama disaster (she inexplicably retrieved my brand new camera which I had inadvertently dropped and left inside a taxi- oh la la, those first few days of our trip's entire memories preserved and salvaged by one act of kindness, hard work and determination- in short, a miracle!...) This 5 day start to a longer holiday was by far the favorite- and a big part of it was Inga and her team.... Can't wait to return again, hopefully soon! And for a much longer stay (though we managed to pack in a ton...) Merci mille fois et au revoir- bonne annee, a mes nouveaux amis a Paris!
reviews.title: Exceptionnel, essential experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is really well situated for the Louvre and the Musee D'Orsay. It's within a few minutes walking distance and the hotel can provide advance tickets for the day to both museums which can save a lot of queuing time at busy periods. The hotel is in a quiet street amid the artr shops of the elft bank. We liked the way the rooms were furnished and decorated, although the decor may be considered a little sparse - some art on the walls would be good. We reserved a superior double room and it was very spacious, especially for Paris. Excellent bathroom, very modern and well equipped with nice towels etc but no moisturiser, for some reason.
reviews.title: Charm with a capital "ch"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfasts were good although without any variation from day to day. There was a signficant extra charge for eggs and anything cooked. Plenty of fruit, bread and pastries, cereals, yoghurts etc so no chance of going hungry.
reviews.title: 2nd stay - Still great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception staff were excellent and extremely helpful. All spoke excellent English and were charming.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If we go back to Paris we would have absolutely no hesitation staying here again.
reviews.title: Great location & excellent service
